Job Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Terminal E Gate 17, Dallas, TX 75261

Duration: 6 Month contract initially

Positions: 1

Job Description:

The Performance Specialist is a vital element to Clients success in Technical Operations.

This candidate works with a group to provide operational insights to Planning, Engineering, Production, Reliability and Support (Clients Internal Customers).

They facilitate this by learning about the data models for Clients maintenance systems, understanding business challenges, discovering organizational tools that are available and then delivering a solution that is of best quality that can be provided.

Clients days are spent working with Clients Internal Customers to better understand their challenges and what can be done to reduce or eliminate those challenges.

Work Activities or Context:

Serves as the focal point for gathering requirements, designing, and scheduling reports.

Proactively looks for ways to improve current reporting and automation procedures.

Performs periodic, ad hoc queries as needed by the business.

Participates in special projects involving initiatives with the business, specifically with Clients Technology group when needed.

Ensures high-quality, daily deliverables by monitoring and communicating issues with Clients Customers and Clients Technology group in a timely manner.

Assists team with testing and authoring solutions when needed.

Serves as lead or owner for report publications and daily automation jobs.

Education:

Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience required.

Work Experience:

Three or more years of broad-based relevant business experience, specifically in the areas of data aggregation, analysis, and reporting required.

Three or more years experience writing SQL against enterprise databases (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, Sybase) required.

Three or more years experience with an enterprise business intelligence platform (e.g. Crystal Reports, SQL Reporting Services) required.

Extensive proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially in Excel (e.g. macros, advanced formulas, pivot tables) required.

Three or more years experience writing automated solutions in a scripting language (e.g. VB Script, VBA) preferred.

Previous experience in data mining, grooming, and aggregation from multiple sources preferred.

Strong math and statistical skills preferred.

Previous experience in Tableau and Alteryx preferred.

Skills or Abilities or Knowledge or Work Style:

Must be able to work well with others as part of a Team.

Proficiency and extensive use of spreadsheets, word processing, graphics, and database software.

Possess strong problem solving skills.

Must possess strong oral and written communication skills.

Must possess strong task organization skills.

Self-motivated and ability to perform with minimal supervision.

Maintain high quality even in complex situations with tight deadlines.

Familiarity with relational database concepts.

Ability to analyze technical issues, find root cause, and recommend alternative solutions.

Work well with people at all levels of the organization.

Work well under pressure while performing multiple concurrent tasks with frequent interruptions.

Perform job functions with limited supervision.

Demonstrate initiative and possess the willingness and skills to adapt and change as technology or processes change.

Job Description

Solomon, the leading performance improvement company for the global energy industry, is seeking candidates for a Business Data Analyst (VBA/SQL/advanced analytics) position to work in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment. This position will work closely with energy industry experts to design and conduct industry benchmarking studies. While these experts provide in-depth knowledge of the industry, these experts must be leveraged by partnering with a skilled data analyst capable of processing large amounts of benchmarking data through various automation tools. As such, this position will play a vital role in all aspects of the benchmarking process, including:• Designing electronic form-based solutions for consistently collecting participant data



Maintaining a relational database for storing the collected data
Performing database uploads, calculations, and queries

Using advanced analytics methods and tools to perform first- and second-level data analysis
Designing and building electronic reports and data visualizations that provide participants with key insights about their performance
Reviewing the final reports for accuracy and delivering them to participants while maintaining the highest level of quality and confidentiality


This role often requires developing creative solutions to respond to ad hoc data requests from both the industry experts and clients. To be successful in this role, the person must be highly collaborative, innovative, responsive, and versatile with the ability to effectively build strong partnerships. The position is located in Solomon’s Dallas, Texas office.

Looking for Data Scientist or Data Modeler who has hands on experience with Amazon Sagemaker.Experience with Machine learning tools. Skills Required:Data Science / Data ModelingAmazon SagemakerMachine Learning Tools

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics team!

What's the team like?

Our team's mission is to use data to deliver long-term strategic insights. We also provide short-term guidance on A/B tests, user behavior etc. We leverage data to understand our users: what they need, what they do, how to retain them and ultimately how to help them find the best dates.

We also work to support business trends/forecasting, model the impact of new product ideas on Revenue/EDITDA and other metrics.

What's my day-to-day?

You will help guide Match's product decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing, building models and driving key insights. You'll also work with other cross-functional teams like Finance, CRM, Engineering and Business Intelligence.


Provide internal consulting to product management, marketing and CRM teams on A/B tests as they move from initiatives from concept to market
Identify strategic opportunities to apply data science where it will offer cross functional benefits
Provide key insights to internal customers on their specific ad-hoc needs
Serve as the subject matter expert on applying various statistical methodologies towards distilling actionable insights
Research issues about customer behavior/changes by analyzing relevant metrics, trends etc. supporting enterprise level initiatives
Assist with conducting member market research - design questionnaires, analyze data and provide meaningful insights

What skills is Match looking for?

3+ years of SQL (T-SQL preferred)
Exposure to applied statistics (descriptive statistics, statistical testing, design of experiments, linear modelling, time series analysis etc); Python/SPSS/SAS/R experience a strong plus
Hands on experience with ML platforms such as tensorflow highly desirable
Advanced Excel knowledge
Excellent problem solving skills
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering / related field, Marketing, or MBA with quantitative focus
Self-starter with good communications skills
Experience in consumer internet preferred

*applicants will be required to complete a SQL and Data Analysis skills assessment test

Why Match?

A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We've helped millions of people find love and happiness.


You can wear jeans every day
Our benefits and perks are pretty amazing
Drinks and snacks are on us every single day
We have happy hours monthly, so there's always something to celebrate

Job Description

This position is regulatory focused with expertise in consumer reporting agency products, services including consumer direct services, credit bureau reporting and data broker services as it pertains to our personal identification and credit management. This spans from pre-analysis to determine if the data received from county or 3rd party sources meet the specifics needed to be considered for inclusion. Writing the business rules utilized for programming and UAT QA, to conducting the final review to make sure the programming and QA were sufficiently done, to having expert level knowledge of our data assets and processes.

Job Duties


Strong subject matter expertise in developing compliance management, privacy and data governance programs to streamline business processes and enhance operational controls.Proficiency in consumer privacy regulations, such as FCRA and GLBA.Drives decisions of business rule changes based on data content analysis. Conceptualization of data and shares knowledge through effective presentation of the data to internal stakeholders and external clients. Participates in ongoing decisions regarding design, data collection and data analysis. May interface directly with clients in response to data inquiries, review and explain data content and solicit client feedback as it relates to data enhancements.

position: Consultant, Financial Shared Services Data Analyst
Job Description:
FI Consulting is seeking a full-time Consultant to work in our Arlington, VA Headquarters and throughout the Metro DC area on client projects.

 Responsibilities of this Role Include:

Assist in the maintenance of a Data Management Strategy for a large transition to a financial shared serve provider's target system
Participate in Data Conversion/Data Clean-up working groups with stakeholders
Track stakeholder validation of data clean-up and data cleansing activities, including development and maintenance of data cleansing dashboards
Execute data conversion and data clean-up activities such as analyzing source system data for data integrity; development and execution of cleansing scripts
Monitor, maintenance, and updating of the Program Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), propose changes and additions, as necessary
Validate traceability between Operational Requirements, Functional Requirements, and lower-level System Requirements to testing artifacts, ensuring that all requirements are accounted for
Work independently, and as a team, to achieve client objectives
Interface with client personnel at various levels

 Minimum Qualifications:

U.S. Citizenship is required. Successful candidates must be able to obtain a favorable fitness/clearance determination with the client
A minimum of 3 years' experience conducting quantitative analyses of information affecting investment programs of public and private institutions
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Financial Engineering, Accounting, Mathematics or other applicable quantitative or technical field
Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint
Demonstrated experience in data management
Experience in shared service support environments
Demonstrated ability to provide high attention to detail and ability to ensure high quality work
Demonstrated ability to understand complex data and business processes
A consulting background is preferred

Who We Are: FI Consulting is a 65-person professional services firm that helps government and commercial financial institutions solve hard problems in data, analytics, modeling, and technology. Our professionals are specialists with expertise across a range of fields, for example:

- Financial and economic modeling

- Data analytics & visualization

- Financial products and markets

- Economics and statistics

- Business process management and re-engineering

Our Company Values & Operates on:

A Commitment to Creating Value for our Clients and our Employees
A Flat Management Structure that is Still Led by one of the Original Founders
An Emphasis on Teamwork and Cooperation
Employee Development and Career Growth
Continuous Improvement
An Entrepreneurial Culture that Rewards Finding, Developing, and Owning Business

What its really like to Work for Us:

You will work with a team of smart, talented people in a culture that is simultaneously driven, collegial, and supportive. We set high expectations for employees in the areas of project delivery excellence, building trusted client relationships, and continuous improvement. We insist on teamwork and collaboration.

FLSA Designation - This is an exempt position

FI Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities

Description:The stated position will support data science (understand business challenges, how data is associated with business processes, characteristics of data and its application in solving business challenges by building ML models) needs of $10B business area (Missiles & Fire Control) within Lockheed Martin that is growing very rapidly. Data Science efforts are key to Lockheed Martins top transformation initiative to become a data-driven company and leveraging advanced analytics capabilities across the various functional areas at MFC. This position is a Technology Leader role, reporting through Enterprise IT (EIT) and partners with Missiles & Fire Control IT organization.



As Data Science Lead, the successful candidate for this position will be responsible for implementation and sustainment of data science solutions for MFC business by collaborating with business analysts, other data analysts to identify data subjects relevant to provide insights, solve business problems, gather and refine data, build effective ML models.
The Data Science Lead is expected to demonstrate their superior and distinct competency in understanding intricacies of business processes and data, ability to bridge that knowledge to their technical competency in building machine learning models systematically and methodically.
The Data Science Lead will be responsible for designing and implementing advanced analytical solutions for the organization. Projects will be fast paced with extremely tight deadlines. The Data Science lead will be the primary person responsible for ensuring the data analytics team delivers sound analytical results on time. Project teams will be comprised of cross functional members for MFC business and across Lockheed Martin.
Collaborate with business leads across the company to plan and execute valuable data science projects. Engage with key stakeholders in the business and on product and software teams to clearly understand and scope analytical requests.
Lead your team in design sessions and ensure your team delivers high quality work that aligns with Lockheed Martins data analytics strategy.
Test and learn to influence and drive the creation of new methods and best practices in the use of statistical data modeling and machine learning techniques in a big data environment to build these advanced analytics capabilities for many functions in Lockheed Martins business operations.
Mine, analyze, and model large structured and unstructured datasets, and apply advanced statistical predictive models and machine learning algorithms to create actionable business metrics or solve business questions.
Lead data analysis, synthesize results, and develop and present strategic recommendations for the executive leadership and program teams that inspire action.

Basic Qualifications:

This role requires a bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study. Ph.D. or masters degree in Data Science, Data Management Design Principles, Applied Mathematics Systems preferred.



10+ years experience in Data Analysis & Data Science in diverse technology contexts with depth in data & information architectures - structured and unstructured preferably in Aerospace & Defense or in large manufacturing industries for descriptive/diagnostic and predictive, prescriptive analytical needs.
A strong history working throughout the complete lifecycle (from idea to execution) for machine learning in Python, R etc. This would include parametric and non-parametric modeling for supervised and unsupervised solutions.
A strong understanding in the different ML techniques and variable reduction approaches as well as parameter and hyper-parameter tuning.
Strong coding skills are paramount here. You will need the ability to script and program to mine data, automate tasks, etc. (e.g. using Python, Shell Scripting etc.).
A history of successful model integrations, deployments, and training for end users. Experience working with Domino Data Lab, GitHub is a plus.
Strong experience with data munging in SQL and NoSQL environments for both structured and unstructured data.
Experience working with RDBMS and distributed technologies (e.g. Spark, MapReduce, Hive, or Pig).
Experience sourcing and merging additional external sources of data.
A history of leading junior team members. This position can have junior team members added as our scope expands.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong relationship building skills to influences non-technical audience including senior product and business management.
Advanced experience building cloud scalable, real time and high-performance data lake solutions leveraging AWS, EMR, S3, Hive & Spark


Required Knowledge and Skills



Design and build reusable components, frameworks and libraries at scale to support analytics products
Design and implement product features in collaboration with Business and Technology stakeholders
Anticipate, identify and solve issues concerning data management to improve data quality
Clean, prepare and optimize data at scale for ingestion and consumption
Drive the implementation of new data management projects and re-structure of the current data architecture
Implement complex automated workflows and routines using workflow scheduling tools
Build continuous integration, test-driven development and production deployment frameworks
Drive collaborative reviews of design, code, test plans and dataset implementation performed by other data engineers in support of maintaining data engineering standards
Analyze and profile data for designing scalable solutions
Troubleshoot complex data issues and perform root cause analysis to proactively resolve product and operational issues
Mentor and develop other data engineers in adopting best practices

Desired Skills:

Experience in working with data integration and data warehousing solutions preferably in an SAP ecosystem.
Skilled in business domain modeling and logical and physical relational data modeling/design using SAP tools and other emerging tools (such as Tableau) for self-service analytics needs
Ability to do Data Asset Discovery, Data Profiling to ascertain delivery of high-quality data through data governance.
Skilled in data analysis and facilitation, i.e., able to produce data designs using a variety of inputs such as requirements analysis, SME interviews, business process and data flow analysis, data profiling, etc.
Persuasive in influencing strategic architecture direction, framing reference architectures, specifying policies and standards, drive consensus on target state architectures, and influence roadmaps.
Experience with SAP ECC, SAP HANA, Microsoft SQL Server, as well as familiarity with ETL tools (SAP SLT, DSAP Data Services) and data profiling processes/tools.
Knowledgeable about Business Intelligence/analytics tools and their appropriate use in solutions for diverse business requirements with clarity in understanding business needs around running the business vs managing the business.
Prior experience in working with community of data scientists to understand their data needs, data utilization in advanced analytical use cases.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Job DescriptionPosition Description: Reporting Data Analyst

Location - 75063, Irving, TX

Duration: 9/10/2018 to 12/14/2018 (Contract to permanent)

The Data Query Analyst is a key role in supporting organizational readiness, performance and the overall success of services within the company. This is an exciting and challenging role that directly supports the organizations Business Intelligence function through monitoring of business unit performance, assessing opportunities for process improvement and supporting the implementation of strategic initiatives.

The ideal candidate possesses in-depth knowledge of the healthcare and pharmaceutical industry, understands key service level and success measures and demonstrates an ability to identify underlying causes and correlations. The candidate must exhibit exceptional analytic and problem-solving abilities as well as strong communication and presentation skills that enable them to lead internal and client discussions to drive information-based decisions to be made.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The primary roles of the Data Analyst fall into three primary categories:



Client Reporting
Engages with clients on highly complex or escalated requests
Query SQL databases and/or data warehouse to create daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly contractual reporting external clients
Deliver contractual reporting requirements in adherence to the outlined schedule, format and delivery method
Provide final-line manual Quality Control for reports going to clients and third-party vendors
Review client contracts to verify ability, feasibility, and compliance needs to deliver requested data reports
Offer consultation to program management team during the launch of a program regarding capabilities of reporting in to provide client with pertinent ongoing data
Provide production support for all client questions pertaining to data delivered per contractual requirements
Provide ad hoc reports based on client and internal business needs while meeting an agreed upon deadline
Identify and communicate specific coding problems to the development team
Identify new process improvement opportunities to improve data quality with the operational teams
Format visual output of data analysis for external customer review
Prepare quarterly business reviews for clients
Internal Reporting
Build back-end procedures and views to drive front-end visualization frameworks
Assist in creating visualization frameworks in SSRS and/or Tableau to provide internal recipients insights into productivity
Understand business unit workflow to find opportunities to improve the collection of data so that internal groups are not negatively impacted with additional steps and can better serve the needs of patients and clients
Collaborate with the IT Development team and Program Management team to develop enhanced reporting tools
Assist in automating day to day responsibilities of groups across the organization so that efficiencies are achieved
Create self-service reporting tools for business unit leadership and program management
Takes leadership role on cross-functional projects that engage multiple departments or business units
Develops and writes documentation for departmental processes
Ad hoc Querying
Write on-demand queries to solve in-the-moment business questions
Interpret data, analyze results to proactively provide performance feedback to business units within the organization
Lead ongoing analysis and reporting related to business unit performance recommended courses of action
Troubleshoot with internal groups if accurate data is not being collected or captured
Takes a lead role in developing and training Reporting and Data Query Analysts
Drives innovation by searching for and evaluating new tools, processes, and ways of thinking about data


Qualifications and Requirements



Bachelor's degree in applicable field, computer science, business, or equivalent experience related to healthcare operations
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with multiple internal and external audiences
3+ years of previous experience in pharmaceuticals or related healthcare field
4+ years of data analysis experience
Database query language experience (simple and complex queries)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, SQL and T-SQL, SSRS, Tableau
Exceptional communication skills
Experience working with internal and external customers
Demonstrated strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Very strong attention to detail

What you’ll be doing...

Join our IT Application Security team responsible for advanced data analytics for cyber threat hunting. You will function as a Data Scientist providing strategic direction for the Application Security Team developing architecture for Big Data Cybersecurity projects. You will develop complex data models using machine learning and AI functions. You will drive the adoption of Big Data analytics based on evaluated industry and corporate requirements.

You will be responsible for researching, designing and prototyping scalable models based on machine learning, data mining, and statistical modeling to solve key Security and Fraud problems. You will build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, pares data elements, feature selection and feature engineering in conjunction with best practices. You will work with development and security teams to ensure models can be implemented as part of a delivered solution replicable across many clients. You will lead in developing fraud use cases to identity and catalog user behavior to finger print traffic in real time.

Presenting findings to stakeholders to drive improvements and solutions from concept through to delivery.Keeping up-to-date on the latest developments in the field by continuous learning and proactively champion promising new methods relevant to the problems at hand.Leading application teams to develop risk KPIs and identifies critical events to be sent for cross channel analysis.Working with other security teams to develop Fraud Cases to detect and mitigate customer account compromise.Performing real time stream analysis to alert and mitigate malicious HTLM traffic flows.Conducting application cross channel analysis to detect and alert on multithread attacks.Researching and investigating new fraud attacks against Verizon.

What we’re looking for...

You’ll need to have:

Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.Six or more years of relevant work experience.Experience developing advanced analytic queries using Spark, MapR, Splunk or Elk.

Even better if you have:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Mathematics or equivalent.Understanding of cybersecurity, networking traffic analysis, intrusion detection, offensive security, data science, big data analyses, predictive analytics and computer science.Ability to script in multiple languages like Python (including ETL: HDFS, Hive, Nifi, Scoop, PIG, Oozie, HDP2.6, etc.).Experience working with Kafka, Elastic Search, Kibana in real time solutions.Demonstrated history of leading and delivering analytics models and solutions.Demonstrated strong skills in software prototyping and engineering with expertise in applicable programming and analytics languages (Python, R, C/C++) and open source machine learning and analytics packages to generate deliverable modules and prototype demonstrations.Demonstrated ability to propose novel solutions to problems, performing experiments to show feasibility of their solutions and working to refine the solutions into a real-world context.Ability to perform statistical analysis and inference, data modeling, clustering and predictive analysis independently.Experience normalizing and parsing large data sets.Experience with Big Data AWS Cloud.

When you join Verizon...

You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

 JOB PURPOSE:
We're looking for an experienced leader with a track record of successfully developing and deploying data science solutions to join our growing Enterprise Analytics area. The Senior Director will lead a team or teams of data scientists to create new products across a variety of business areas and domains through use of machine learning, natural language processing, data visualization techniques, and other forms of advanced analytics.  The Enterprise Analytics team is also a Center of Excellence for data science at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois, New Mexico, Montana, Oklahoma & Texas. This person will spend approximately a quarter of their time promoting best practices in data science, leading and organizing technical training for the broader community, and driving a data-driven culture across the enterprise.  At the largest customer-owned and not-for-profit health insurer and fourth largest health insurer overall in the United States, you will have the opportunity to work with massive datasets to drive revenue growth, improve our operational and member-facing processes, reduce cost of care, and affect how healthcare is delivered to our 15+ million members.  An ideal candidate would be someone who enjoys leading, mentoring, and developing junior technical staff, loves creatively solving complex business problems using advanced analytics, demonstrates a continuous learning and growth mindset, possesses an interest in the intersection of healthcare and technology, and has an ability to partner with non-technical customers to deliver and operationalize product-based solutions.
Required Job Qualifications: * Bachelor’s degree and 7 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR 2 or more advanced degrees and 6 years of work experience in a in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR Ph.D. and 4 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR 11 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical , engineering, physics or related quantitative field. Leadership and/or management experience.* 4 years of management experience.* Learning and growth mindset.* Customer-focused.* Interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.* Experience in at least five of the following six areas:1) data analysis and relational-style query languages; 2) machine learning and/or statistical modeling; 3) data visualization; 4) a high-level programming language; 5) distributed computing. 6) understanding of healthcare.
* Microsoft applications including Access, Excel, Word and Power Point.* A track record of independently delivering or leading the delivery of a complex analytics or data science project.* Mentoring, managing, or leading junior analytics or data science staff. 
Preferred Job Qualifications:* Masters or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, or Bachelor’s degree with significant healthcare experience* A track record of leading the successful implementation and deployment of data science initiatives using primarily open source languages and tools, such as Python, R, Spark, Hive, and Pig* Previous success in hiring, developing, and retaining data science talent* Ability to simplify complex technical concepts and processes for non-technical business partners

EBI DATA ANALYST II

Responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, design requirements, test cases and scripts, test plans, and facilitating user acceptance testing for Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions. The employee will work with other technical team members to deploy solutions based on departmental documentation and testing standards. The Data Analyst II may be assigned project or support activities.

The Data Analyst II assumes tasks of a moderate to high level of complexity and difficulty. In addition, the Data Analyst II will be expected to meet with end-users individually without direct supervision within the scope of their assigned tasks.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Must have at least 5 years of experience in the capacity of a business or data analyst.

Require at least 4 years of experience in Data Warehousing, ODS, or other reporting environment.

Combined experience of 5 years in the healthcare, supply chain or finance domains.

Experience writing SQL queries against relational databases of moderate to high complexity.

Experience with SDLC a must, exposure to Agile/SCRUM practices is ideal.

Must possess excellent documentation and communication skills.

Scope/Impact: -

Job Functions

+ Document and gather detailed business requirements for data, reporting and business intelligence solutions.

+ Document and gather detailed data design specifications for data, reporting and business intelligence solutions.

+ Document and gather detailed functional design specifications for reporting and business intelligence solutions.

+ Define and document detailed ETL specifications for Data Warehouse interface, extracts, staging areas, atomic areas and mart database environments.

+ Develop test cases and SQL test scripts based on detail data design, detail functional design and ETL specifications.

+ Execute QA data and functional test activities. Perform root cause analysis.

+ Manage the resolution of defects.

+ Manage the resolution of project and support issues within the scope of assigned tasks.

+ Own and be fully accountable for assigned support of existing applications including: keeping end-user contact lists up to date, keeping communication SLA's up to date, evaluating and scoping new requests and incidents.

+ Performs other position appropriate duties as required in a competent, professional and courteous manner.

May perform other duties as assigned or requested.

Organizational Core Competency Requirements:

Communication - Communicates openly and in a timely way. Listens to understand. Speaks and writes clearly. Shares information appropriately. Keeps others well informed. Encourages others to share contrary views. Responds in a timely manner to messages/requests.

Adaptability/Flexibility - Deals effectively with change and uncertainty. Copes well with stress and pressure. Is patient. Maintains a positive outlook. Deals constructively with mistakes and setbacks. Looks for ways to help the organization.

Teamwork - Works together to achieve successful outcomes. Seeks input from others. Seeks win-win solutions. Supports a shared purpose. Builds relationships. Supports others to achieve success. Knows when to compromise and find mutually acceptable solutions.

Organizational Universal Competency Requirements:

Integrity - Models the BHCS values. Establishes trust. Is honest. Demonstrates high ethical and legal standards. Follows regulatory and compliance standards. Is respectful and fair. Holds self and others accountable for demonstrating the values - "Walks the Talk".

Servanthood - Uses power, authority and/or influence constructively. Leads and follows by example. Demonstrates an attitude of unselfish concern. Develops him or herself and supports the development of others. Understands and values the perspective of others.

Quality - Optimizes clinical outcomes. Achieves high quality results. Maintains customer focus. Provides customer value. Provides a safe environment. Continuously improves. Tackles problems head-on and resolves them without delay. Produces good results.

Innovation - Creates and supports new ideas and opportunities that are aligned with BHCS strategic priorities. Leads and adapts to change. Challenges the status quo. Plans appropriately. Solves problems. Exercises sound judgment in solving problems.

Stewardship - Uses resources responsibly. Is accountable. Applies sound judgment. Makes informed decisions. Takes appropriate action. Maintains business and industry knowledge. Works to enhance the fiscal strength of BHCS. Spends time on most important work.

The ideal candidate has excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

+ Location/Facility - Dallas, TX

For more information on the facility, please click our Locations link.

+ Specialty/Department/Practice - Information Technology

+ Shift/Schedule - Full Time (Day Shift)

+ Benefits - Our competitive benefits package includes*:

+ Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits

+ 401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%

+ Tuition Reimbursement

+ PTO accrual beginning Day 1



Note: Benefits may vary based upon position type and/or level.


Baylor Scott & White Health (BSWH) is the largest not-for-profit health care system in Texas and one of the largest in the United States. With a commitment to and a track record of innovation, collaboration, integrity and compassion for the patient, BSWH stands to be one of the nation's exemplary health care organizations. Job Description

Solomon, the leading performance improvement company for the global energy industry, is seeking candidates for a Business Data Analyst (VBA/SQL/advanced analytics) position to work in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment. This position will work closely with energy industry experts to design and conduct industry benchmarking studies. While these experts provide in-depth knowledge of the industry, these experts must be leveraged by partnering with a skilled data analyst capable of processing large amounts of benchmarking data through various automation tools. As such, this position will play a vital role in all aspects of the benchmarking process, including:



Designing electronic form-based solutions for consistently collecting participant data
Maintaining a relational database for storing the collected data
Performing database uploads, calculations, and queries
Validating the data for accuracy by designing data quality checks
Using advanced analytics methods and tools to perform first- and second-level data analysis
Designing and building electronic reports and data visualizations that provide participants with key insights about their performance
Reviewing the final reports for accuracy and delivering them to participants while maintaining the highest level of quality and confidentiality


This role often requires developing creative solutions to respond to ad hoc data requests from both the industry experts and clients. To be successful in this role, the person must be highly collaborative, innovative, responsive, and versatile with the ability to effectively build strong partnerships. The position is located in Solomon's Dallas, Texas office.

Qualifications

Education

Required:

Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent

Preferred:

Engineering degree or MBA


Work Experience

Required:

37 years of programming experience in a Microsoft environment (VBA, Excel macros, etc.)
15 years Microsoft SQL database programming experience
Experience using advanced analytical methods and tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, custom tools, etc.)


Technical Skills

Required:

Microsoft Office VBA development, Database development (Microsoft SQL Server preferred)

Preferred:

C# programming, VB.NET programming, Web programming (JavaScript, HTML, etc.)


Non-Technical Skills

Required:

Excellent writing and verbal skills working with both developers and non-technical personnel
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel and PowerPoint)

Preferred:

Experience in an engineering firm, especially oil, gas, or petrochemicals


Other

Required:

Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, the ability to work independently with limited supervision
High energy and an inquisitive mind

Preferred:

Bilingual


Employment Type

Full Time

RumbleOn is seeking a highly motivated, self-starter to be our next Marketing Data Analyst! This position will handle analytics for our fast-paced, cutting edge company with regards to marketing initiatives, sales, and overall company goals; including the areas of list strategy, development and segmentation, list aggregation, campaign performance analysis, and forecasting and reporting as it relates to business planning.

Do you have a deep understanding of quantitative and qualitative market analysis? Do you have experience writing SQL Queries and creating visualizations of key data points? Are you experienced in the Digital Marketing landscape?

If yes, join our growing e-Commerce company that is taking the powersports industry by storm! We are a group passionate, driven, hard-working people who like to have fun! We offer a laid back environment where your ideas are heard, your talents are valued, and you are surrounded by amazingly supportive people!

The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to use data to advise the Marketing Director and Stakeholders on how best to drive business results and maximize and optimize lead acquisition through our Digital Advertising Channels. This candidate must blend a high proficiency in accessing and manipulating data with a strong ability to turn data into strategic insights and recommendations. The role requires knowledge of customer acquisition, marketing automation, and list segmentation in order to identify effective lead segments at the right time, to deliver maximum ROI, as well as match-back customer journeys that are tied to company goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide data-driven analysis to uncover and articulate key insights and recommendations to various stakeholders in the organization Focus on segmentation, data quality and enrichment, and reporting while identifying a high volume of quality contacts (prospects) that ultimately drive sales leads. Perform universe segmentation; use data to advise marketing managers and director, sales and leadership team on how best to drive business results and maximize lead acquisition and conversion Determine more cost-effective means to deliver on marketing objectives through use of marketing automation, by identifying most effective segments and channels Continually monitor leads based on engagement levels, sales cycle length, deal source, and other criteria Monitor and track effectiveness of all campaign efforts and channel attribution

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree Preferred but not Required if you have proven experience. 3+ Years’ Experience in Data Analysis (specializing in Marketing Data Analysis) 3+ Years Experience working with Digital Marketing teams and campaigns Must be proficient in utilizing, visualizing and building dashboarding tools Must be able to write SQL Queries and Join Data Tables Google Analytics Certification preferred, Google Analytics Experience a Must Background in, or have worked in Digital Focused Marketing Teams Preferred Experience with business data analysis and forecasting, universe segmentation, customer acquisition, email marketing, marketing automation, CRM and campaign analysis Report creation experience with business intelligence tools a must 1-2 Years Experience with Domo (preferred) Experience with Hubspot (a plus) Must live local to the DFW area (we need someone to start soon and will not be able to wait for relocation)

Benefits

What RumbleOn Offers You:

A fun, relaxed, and casual work environment with awesome people by your side working as a team to ensure the entire group's success! Plus...

Healthcare, Dental, & Vision Insurance (RumbleOn pays 100% of employees medical premium!!!) Competitive compensation packages based on experience and skills Competitive Vacation/PTO (12 PTO days year 1, plus 7 Paid Holidays for a total of 19 days year 1!) Close knit, open, inviting startup environment where you can make your mark and where your ideas are heard! Employee discounts on purchases Fully stocked kitchen with drinks and snacks all day Fun company events The opportunity for growth and a solid long term career...we promote from within!! And more…

Job Description

We are in a data science renaissance.

Companies that embrace data science will lead and those who do not will fall behind.

To help IBM's clients lead, we are building an elite team of data science practitioners to help them learn how to succeed with data science. The team will include data engineers, machine learning engineers, operations research / optimization engineers and data journalists.

The team will engage directly in solving real-world data science problems in a wide array of industries around the globe with IBM clients and internally to IBM. The elite team of data scientist will work with other IBMers and client data science teams to solve problems in banking, insurance, health care, manufacturing, oil & gas and automotive industries, to name a few. The Data Science team conceptualizes, develops, deploys, and maintains predictive models using advanced statistical and machine learning methods. These models are used in Elevate’s Underwriting, Account Management, and Operations applications. The Sr. Data Scientist plays a critical role by applying cutting-edge modeling techniques to drive growth, control risk, and ensure operations excellence. Primary Responsibilities:Design, Develop and Deploy advanced machine learning and Artificial Intelligence algorithms/predictive models for use in Underwriting, Customer Management, Marketing, and Operations;Assess, clean, merge, and analyze large datasets adhering to standardized data manipulation techniques and methodology by leveraging R, Python and/or Apache Spark;Perform parallel processing computations both within R as well as cluster computing technologies such as Apache Spark.Design, Develop and Deploy multiple linear and nonlinear algorithms for testing, development and deployment into our underwriting engine in the application of risk management in all of Elevate’s acquisition channels;Efficiently apply data mining methodologies to minimize credit/fraud losses, maximize response and approval rates, and develop methods to enhance profitability of Elevate products;Successfully implement scoring models on multiple decision platforms Including R instance deployment, On premise deployment and cloud deployment and multiple forms such as Java objects, R Object Models and Apache Spark Models;Provide knowledge, insight and guidance of third party data providers such as Transunion, Clarity/Experian and Equifax to include knowledge of products and data available, products to purchase or discontinue, cost benefit analysis of retrospective analysis, effective use of variables, data dictionaries as well as advantages and limitations;Maintain clear, detailed model documentation on our Wiki Server by leveraging reproducible research technologies such as Rmarkdown, IPython, Jupyter Notebook, etc.;Functional lead and point of contact with business partners to support the needs and goals of all Elevate portfolios, Rock teams, Braintrusts and Pods.Lead analytical projects by leveraging and coaching Jr Data Scientists. Ability to analyze trends and suggest solutions to challenges. Job Overview

We are looking for a Data Scientist who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities for Data Scientist

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.

Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.

Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.

Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.

Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.

Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.

Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.

Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

Skills Required for Data Scientist

Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.

Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.

Experience working with and creating data architectures.

Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.

Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.

Knowledge on following software/tools:

Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java,

JavaScript, etc.

Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.

Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc.

Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc.

Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.

Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc.

Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc.

Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.

position: Data Scientist - AWM Production and Infrastructure
Job Description:
Asset and Wealth Management Production and Infrastructure (AWMP&I) technology team develops and manages the suite of applications, infrastructure components and systems that support financial accounting, client reporting, business profitability analysis, information websites, investment engines, pricing databases, decision-making and data processing. The technologies and business applications we support and provide oversight for include business applications, data centers, servers, desktops, networks, communications systems, contingency sites and much more. 
 
AWMP&I is comprised of a global management team who specialize in:

Production Support (Application Services Delivery)
Technology Infrastructure Architecture and Engineering
Distributed Computing Infrastructure Support
End User Technology
Infrastructure Solutions Management
We're looking for an individual to apply data analytics/data scientist techniques to drive better discussions and help solve difficult problems. This person must be creative, self-motivated, persistent, and innovative. The issues faced will be diverse and involve financial modeling, inventory analysis, cost optimization, and forecasting. Success in this role will be defined by the individual's ability to understand data about technology infrastructure stored in disparate data stores and produce useful outputs that save costs, allow for smarter decisions, predict future demand, and address capacity issues. 
 
Responsibilities:

Use data about the firm's infrastructure to drive better decisions, lower costs, help infrastructure groups understand their infrastructure better.
Work cross team to define problem statements, collect data, build analytics models
Create data drive optimization models for technology infrastructure
Leverage tools like R, R Studio, Python, Hadoop, SQL.
Further leverage machine learning techniques and algorithms like k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests to improve the process
Qualifications

BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
Proficient knowledge in the following key areas: Infrastructure Architecture (database, middleware, SAN, networks, virtualization, etc.).
Proficiency in query languages like SQL, JSON, Hive, etc.
Ability to work independently with little oversite.
Good experience in operationalizing data governance and data quality.
Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It’s our mission to efficiently take care of our clients’ wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Across 27 cities, our team of 4,600 agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

_Job Description: Data Analyst_

_What Business Metrics/Analytics contributes to Cardinal Health_

Business Metrics/Analytics is responsible for understanding, preparing, processing and analyzing data to make the data valuable and useful for operational and/or decision\-making purposes\. This includes developing, quantifying and evaluating internal data into business intelligence to support the strategic objectives of the organization and drive operational excellence\. Includes data and technology management \(data acquisition, analysis, data integrity management, metrics management and reporting\.\)

_What is expected of you and others at this level_

+ Uses knowledge of business objectives, strategies, and needs to identify opportunities where data can be leveraged to achieve the desired business benefits\.

+ Understands current data context, processes and availability, and how current data processes and existing data can be leveraged to achieve the desired benefits\.

+ Prepares and analyzes data\. This can include: locating, profiling, cleansing, extracting, mapping, importing, transforming, validating or modeling\.

+ Performs validation and testing to confirm the accuracy of the information created\.

+ Communicates complex information so that it is easy to understand\.

+ Weighs the reliability of completing sources of information, to resolve discrepancies\.

+ Works on projects of moderate scope and complexity\.

+ Identifies possible solutions to a variety of technical problems and takes actions to resolve\.

+ Applies judgment within defined parameters\.

+ Receives general guidance may receive more detailed instruction on new projects\.

+ Work reviewed for sound reasoning and accuracy\.

_Accountabilities_

+ Effective internal and external communication skills both verbal and written\.

+ Ability to work without direct supervision\.

+ Attention to detail, and follow\-through on assigned tasks\.

+ Responsible for tracking all operational, metrics related to the client?s product portfolio\.

+ Works under the general supervision of the CRM\.

+ Supports the CRM in preparing for daily, weekly, and monthly business reviews with the client\.

+ Understands the client?s product patient journey and competitive marketplace dynamics and applies that knowledge in analytical models\.

+ Works with other analytical and IT experts across the business\.

+ Articulates business intelligence insights to client alongside the CRM as the CRM?s subject matter expert on analytics and insights\.

+ Responsible for maintaining spreadsheets, databases, and other models that are developed to run analytical outputs\.

+ Uses Excel and Tableau regularly for data visualization presentations for the client\.

_Qualifications_

+ Bachelor's Degree in related field, or equivalent work experience

+ Must have experience working within databases

+ Must have advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint

We have an immediate opportunity available for an experienced, reliable, and hard working Master Data Analyst to join the team.

This Supply Chain team lead position will be responsible for the SAP Material Master module. The job focus of this role is to effectively manage the SAP materials originating from Marketing, New Product Development, Manufacturing and Procurement groups that require creation and changes to support Order to Delivery process. The position is challenged to quickly and correctly identify problems. The incumbent generally resolves issues by following departmental guidelines or applying a solution that worked in the past. The team lead or supervisor gives general instructions on what needs to be done, when it needs to be done and how it is typically done. The jobholder knows in advance the details of what needs to be done to serve customers and the standard procedures in place to accomplish it. They can change different parts of the standard approach to serve customers best, but cannot add or delete procedures without approval.

This position will be based out of the corporate office located in Irving, Texas.

Responsibilities

This position will be responsible following, additional duties may be assigned as necessary:



Responsible for executing the end-to-end master data processes. Responsible for participating with all process areas to ensure the end to end quality of the master data, which ensures supply chain and plant production execution
Collaborates with New Product Development, Consumer Marketing Team, Purchasing, Accounting, Production, Planning, Customer Service and quality managers to provide timely release and implementation of new and changed master data
Required to work effectively with diverse, cross-functional groups in order to execute the master data process by understanding the integrated nature of master data
Follows progress of material master creation and changes and provides guidance to resolve problems
Proposes and implements improvements for the MDM operating model
Creates BOM's and Routings as needed per planning; Bill of Materials and Routing Maintenance
Strong understanding of integrated supply chain and business processes impacted by master data
Extends material to different sales org. channels in SAP as needed by Customer Service Representative
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to creatively solve complex problems
Coordinates all product, component, and supplier data files including:


a. Data entry.

b. Purchasing info records (PIR), quality info records (QIR), and source lists (S/L.)c. Oversee the submission of new vendor requestsd.d. Manage new part number requests in SAP



Provides other departments with training in the master data processes and procedures as needed
Key interface between Documentation / Change Management system and SAP
Daily operational MDM processes and master data maintenance (entry of new or change of existing master data elements) in SAPECC
Ongoing improvements and documentation of the MDM (Master Data Management) data standards, process flows and supporting systems
Ongoing measurement and auditing of master data content & quality
Suggests and implements solutions to business problems related to master data

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor's degree.


Experience: Ideal candidates will be individuals of considerable influencing and sophisticated leadership skills whose previous experience includes:



Minimum of 2 years of SAP or closely related ERP experience • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills• Ability to independently identify and resolve problems or take advantage of opportunities. • Bachelor's degree or equivalent business/supply chain experience• Technical knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning (Master Data Maintenance), specifically SAP• Experience with data analysis • Technical aptitude to become familiar with new applications and application areas at a rapid pace

Computer Skills:

To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of:



Strong proficient Microsoft Office skills.
SAP ECC preferred

Other Requirements:

The ideal candidate will help manage the governance of master data policies, procedures, and practices to execute against plan, and holding him or herself and the organization accountable for its results. Key qualities include:



Initiative and proven "self starter".
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills to engage leaders and implementers throughout the organization.
A bias toward action. Makes well-informed, effective and timely decisions, even when data are limited or solutions produce unpleasant consequences; perceives the impact and implications of decisions.
Open to change and new information; adapts rapidly to changing conditions and unexpected obstacles.
Unquestioned honesty and integrity, demonstrating consistency of words and actions.

Description:

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence) who will support our product development in a rapidly growing technology company. This individual will also work with leadership, sales, and marketing teams to gain insights into company, industry, and technology trends. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive results with their data insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for AI and discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Day to day activities...

Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.


Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.


Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.


Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.


Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.


Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.


Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.


Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.


Ability to learn IBM/Watson, Cognitive/Conversational platforms, and Hitachi Vantara Big Data products and Analytics.

What you should have in your "utility belt":

Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.


A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.


Experience using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.


Experience working with and creating data architectures.


Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.


Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.

We're looking for someone with 1 – 2 years' experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models or has an Associate or a Bachelor's in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools:

Coding knowledge and experience with Python is a must.


Experience with Machine Learning Frameworks: Keras, Tensorflow, Torch, PyTorch, Theano, Scikit, H20, SparkML, NLTK, Core NLP.

Artificial Intelligence: Deep Learning, Deep Networks, Natural Language Processing and Understanding (NLP/NLU).

Experience with Advanced Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Python, Linear Regression, Neural Networks, Probabilistic inference, Goal Oriented AI.


Experience with Graph Databases, Neo4J, NoSQL, Neptune, MongoDB, Hadoop, My SQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL.


And of course, the ability to communicate at the right level with all parties involved, from fellow data scientists to executive leadership.

The "nice-to-haves":

Additional experience using alternative statistical computer languages (Java, Javascript, Groovy, C, C++) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.

The Data Analyst is a business oriented technical function responsible for transforming raw data into actionable and meaningful analyses. The individual who fills this role will help business users develop key indicators, identify supporting datasets and build/support repeatable datashboards and reporting mechenisms as well as service ad-hoc data requests to help in decision support processes

Essential Functions/Duties/Responsibilities

Transform raw data into actionable and meaningful analysesWork with a cross-functional team to define and clarify analytic requirements, develop analysis plans, and ensure data quality standardsIdentify key metrics and develop dashboards and/or reports to better the understanding of service delivery performanceEstablish and maintain strong business partnerships and cross-functional relationships to provide decision supportDocument data requirements and think through complex problems to make actionable recommendationsPerform ad-hoc reporting and analyses

Competencies

Ability and passion to analyze complex business processes and understand the details and concepts Desire to learn new skills and grow in a fast paced organizationThe ability to communicate business requirements to developersDetail and task orientedAbility to clearly communicate insights verbally, visually, and in writingCapable of managing time and communication stream effectively to manage/meet deadlines.Capable of taking ownership of projects and demonstrating skills for all phases of projects (Analysis, Design, Development, Deployment, Support)

Supervisory Responsibility

This role does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Statistics, Finance, or Mathematics3-5 years of analytics or quantitative experience in which you extracted meaningful insights from a variety of mixed datasetsPrior experience with utilizing BI tools such as Tableau, QlickView, Microsoft Power BI or MicrostrategyAdvanced Knowledge of SQL (MS SQL Server/Oracle)Basic knowledge of ETL Data Migration tools such as Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

Preferred Skills

A track record for providing reproducible analyses, experience with R or python a plus.Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, vlookups, vba), VSTO is a plus

Essilor is an international company and the leading provider of eyeglass lenses in the world. Our mission is improving lives by improving sight, and we work every day to bring good vision to the 4.5 billion people around the globe in need of visual correction. Our products such as Varilux®, Crizal® and Transitions® are available in more than 130 countries and are worn by one billion people daily. Essilor of America and its subsidiary, Essilor Laboratories of America, Inc., employ more than 7,000 in the U.S. and own the largest and most comprehensive optical laboratory network in the U.S.

Position Summary 

Digital is at the heart of consumer awareness and interaction (search, select, buy) in our category and plays a key role in delivering on our Mission and growth objectives. Towards this end, we seek to establish a leadership position in providing consumers with information and tools to enhance their vision.

Organizing our consumer data is a key pillar to enable us to deliver a compelling value proposition to our consumers and customers.

The Data scientist is responsible for the implementation of specific data requirements, in support of the overall business strategy across all aspects of the DITAC program (consumer acquisition, lead generation through pathways, retention). This includes establishment and administration of databases, data extraction, data mining and reporting tools. He/she has to ensure that the databases meet the requirements of various stakeholders and complies with necessary security details. H/She also has to generate training and manuals for colleagues as new technologies are implemented into the existing databases.

Overall setups and administers the consumer databases, ensuring that they are up to company requirements.
Develop creative solutions to diverse problems including engineering challenges, unstructured data messes, and machine learning applications
Work closely with analysts, data scientists, product managers, and engineers
Implementing data tables, creating queries to automate data extraction, effectively manage existing data available across silos within Essilor and externally.
Operate at level of sophistication in statistics, machine learning, or computer science that is publication-worthy
Must be able to provide assistance & advice with database design and development.
Managing database access & security.
Ensures that databases meet user requirements.
Generating reports, documentation and operating manuals, and training colleagues.
Change management, providing user training, support and feedback.
Develop best practices for performance and operational efficiency.
Provide regular updates to management on database project status.
Stay updated with new database technologies and analyze such technologies to bring into scope of existing infrastructure.

Ability to define objectives through consultation with staff at all levels.
Good troubleshooting skills & solution provider.

Sabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers.



*Job Description**


The travel industry is one of the top 10 transaction processors among banks and social networks. A typical traveler generates at least twice as much data as a savvy internet user.

With travel industry being highly complex and data-driven, this role identifies and solves interesting puzzles which leads to innovative products or directly benefits the financials of the company.

Under minimal or no direction this role is responsible for innovation in the travel space. The successful candidate will be able to identify and prioritize potential ideas, communicate them effectively, gather input from industry experts, and look at the ideas from the point of view of different types of travel industry players (i.e. travel suppliers, travel agents, travel management companies, corporations and travelers alike). This role is also responsible for helping immediate team or internal customers in various business decisions for products and services by using the available data.



*JOB CHARACTERISTICS:**


The candidate will possess the following characteristics:

+ A strong passion to identify and solve real business problems using data

+ Ability to work independently and with minimal or no direction

+ Collaborate efficiently with other technical or non-technical teams

+ Entrepreneurial mindset to identify and promote innovative travel products, and solve the internal puzzles and prototype the end product

+ Ability to move seamlessly between business problems and coding

+ Good presentation skills to explain complicated analytical solutions to a non-technical group of people, internal or external

+ Creativity in using available tools and out-of-the-box thinking to provide the best solution to problems

+ Ability to rapidly prototype and evaluate innovative travel products and applications

+ Persistence and willingness to learn and apply new techniques/new tools constantly

+ Experience working with very large datasets which happen to be residing in different data stores in different formats



*Responsibilities:**


+ Understand business problems and design and build ML/AI and Advanced Analytics models to solve them.

+ Design and build working data pipelines to move data between different source systems to be self-sufficient in Data engineering

+ Own the prototype solution end-to-end

+ Collaborate with other teams efficiently and seamlessly

+ Potentially lead and mentor an intern or another junior member in the team



*Job Requirements**
*Key technical** **qualifications:**


+ At least 5 years of experience with one or more of the following: Python, R, SAS, Spark.

+ Strong hands-on experience with open source Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence libraries such as Spark MLlib, H2o.ai, TensorFlow, etc.

+ Demonstrated experience in scaling and deploying Machine Learning models into production

+ Strong programming skills in one of the following: Python, Scala or Java.

+ Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Business Intelligence, Reporting and other advanced analytics tools and how they access data on different data stores

+ Experience in Hadoop-related technologies, MapReduce, Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala, etc.

+ Good knowledge on Data Warehouses, RDBMS and MPP database skills, including query optimization, and performance tuning

+ Working knowledge in large-scale/distributed SQL, Hadoop, NoSQL, HBase, Columnar databases



*Other qualifications:**


+ Strong ability to drive a project from the beginning to the end

+ Strong process and technical documentation skills

+ Strong communications skills with different levels in the organization as well as a business acumen to understand various types of business problems

+ Experience working with teams who have highly analytical skills

+ Strong desire to learn new technologies and try implementing them

+ Prior leadership and/or mentorship experience will be valuable



*Qualifications**


Graduate (advanced) degree in a highly-technical field, such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Mathematics. PhDs in these fields are strongly recommended to apply.

position: Sr. Cognitive Software Developer Intern Summer
Job Description:
Job Description

START AND END DATES FOR THIS INTERNSHIP ARE DURING SUMMER 2019 (3 months)

At IBM we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with cognitive technology. By using the vast amounts of information available today to identify new patterns and make new discoveries, we are helping cities become smarter, hospitals transform patient care, financial institutions minimize risk, and pharmaceuticals find cures for rare diseases. Join the forward-thinking teams at IBM solving some of the worlds most complex problems there is no better place to grow your career!

Create and maintain machine learning models with a focus on big data.Work in Agile, collaborative environments to understand and develop solutions for requirements. This includes designing, coding and testing innovative applications in areas such as machine learning, computational linguistics, Natural Language Processing (NLP), advanced and semantic information search, extraction, induction, classification and exploration.Assist with implementing, testing and improving algorithmsEmploy IBM Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.Are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.Have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java or Python.Have an interest in, understanding of, or experience with Design Thinking MethodologyHave an interest in, understanding of, or experience with Agile development methodology


Sr. Cognitive Software Developer Interns are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched and deployed to a development team in a strategic business, based on your offered location and fit. These are office-based positions in IBM locations including:

AZ Phoenix
